channel.title: Compiler
channel.description: everytime i open compiler it says i need a newer version of java... I downloaded the newest java version 6 update 20 and still the same thing can any1 help me solve this problem?? thanks. :D

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Xseil Xseil
item.description:
@Xseil wrote:

you fill in the classpath with this…
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.;

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @II_john_II II john II
item.description:
@II_john_II wrote:

ive done that and still the same thing previously my friend told me that i have to download the java EV setter. here is the link, : http://www.mediafire.com/?mdwm2hjbolv

Now, click your start menu and search ‘variables’ then click on “edit the system environment variables” then click under the “Advanced” Tab, click “environment variables…” and delete the path you have now, NOT THE CLASSPATH, (and If you can’t delete it, delete as much as you can then put like 1 random letter or number.)

Ok, run the Java EV Setter as administrator and click where it says “search”, then go to “computer”, then “program files” then look for “java” then find your version of java jdk and double click it then click apply and you’re done!

Now, go back to the environment variables and go back to your path and erase the random letter or number you put in there and click ‘save’ or ‘apply’ (or whatever button is there) and ‘ok’ your way out of those windows. and then try running your compiler.

thats what he said

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Xseil Xseil
item.description:
@Xseil wrote:

oh change “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
to
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java

Now try it…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @II_john_II II john II
item.description:
@II_john_II wrote:

[quote=“mrjad, post:7, topic:347740”]right click on your compiler
click edit
a notepad should open
thats your compiler code[/quote]@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic
